userreviews.userReview: Caveat: This book is 5 stars ONLY if you like sappy dog-rescue vignettes. Apparently, I love them, and thus I loved this book.My Review:I think I'm becoming a dog-book junkie. This collection of owner's descriptions of dogs is, to me, a fascinating look at the way people view their relationships to their favorite pets. The people interviewed in this book are from all walks - the famous, the ordinary, the unknown (including a homeless man). Yes, this is one of those 'feel good' books that some people hate and some people love. I loved it. (Interestingly, I saw this book at Lucky Dog Used Books in Dallas - wasn't looking for it, but there it was. Ha!)

This is a sweet book; the stories of the "found dogs" who were adopted into happy homes are very touching. In addition to providing an enjoyable read for people who already have dogs, I hope it will encourage those looking to add a dog to their family to consider adopting one of the many who are in desperate need of a home. So many times I hear people say that they wouldn't adopt a rescue dog because "they all have serious problems." This book might help to alter that perception.
What a sweet book. Most of the books I read about shelter dogs end up with such sad endings, but this one is all about happy endings.
No monumental insight here. Just personal stories that you could hear from anyone you know. Beautiful photography, though.
4.5 collection of sweet stories of dogs who got a second chance. nice light reading on days where you could use a little lift
A book for lovers of dogs. Uplifting "adoption" stories from people who rescued their forever friends.
Just in case we need more proof that rescues are the best . . . grateful, loyal . . . they can't be beat.Great photos and touching short stories.
If you love dogs, you'll love the stories and pictures in this book. And all royalties are donated to animal-related organizations!
Abandoned/abused dogs that have been adopted and saved by various people, including Al Gore and Jamie Lee Curtis. Some very sad stories that end happily. Complete with photographs.
on loan to me from my aunt (an ultimate dog rescuer herself) who knows i'd have a few of my own if i could

description: Superb photographs and a fascinating cast of people and dogs make this book irresistible to anyone who s moved by the human-animal bond. The dogs included in this book were abandoned in animals shelters, at racetracks, or just by the side of the road. They were found and given a second chance by their current owners, but you ll wonder why they were ever lost when you meet these characters, from the mixed breed service dog with a vocabulary of over 300 words to the tiny furball companion of a female pilot who accompanies her everywhere on the ground and in the air. Renowned author and dog lover Peter Mayle is contributing the forward and celebrity contributions by the likes of Jamie Lee Curtis and Vice-President Albert Gore make this a top-notch collection. The exquisite black and white photographs capture the bond between these people and the dogs they love with incredible emotion and sensitivity. Elise Lufkin is a writer and
title: Found Dogs: Tales of Strays Who Landed on Their Feet
